content: helps to keep all of the necessary resource information synchronized across all of the SSI. DirMaint offers these important features:  DirMaint keeps changes in sync across all of the SSI.  It handles all minidisk assignments and prevents user errors in minidisk assignments.  DirMaint supports all user directory statements within z/VM.  The sequence of directory statements is handled automatically. Several standard tasks need to be performed frequently on z/VM. We provide assistance for these common tasks. 11.4.2 Checking the status of DirMaint and subcomponents The DirMaint QUERY command opens the query window (Figure 11-3), where you can complete various fields to obtain information about the status. Place an X in any one of the options and press PF5 to submit for processing. Use the following command: ===> dirmaint query Figure 11-3 DirMaint QUERY window 11.4.3 Adding a USER to z/VM by using a prototype A USER entry in the z/VM user directory is also known as a Single
